page.title: 07Fakenham Police Force
page.content: The Police Station was built in 1955, and has 3 cells. 1 Inspector, 2 Sergeants and 11 Police Constables work 8hr. shifts, starting at 08.00 and 16.00. Night shift is 23.00-07.00, worked on a rota system. 2-4 officers are on duty at any time. The Fakenham division reaches as far as Snoring (N) Colkirk (S), Sculthorpe (W) and Fulmodstone (E), and deals with crimes (minor theft - murder), sudden deaths, traffic accidents, domestic disputes and lost and found animals and property. The nearest CID unit is at Sheringham. We have 2 police cars - a Ford Escort and a Vauxhall Chevette - and 1 pedal cycle. We have a community relations officer. Guns are kept at North Walsham. This year we gained a police dog and handler. So far this year 180 arrests have been made. In a crisis the men may help another area.
